text:
Every Sunday night, I leave two bags of groceries at the door of the elderly woman who lives two houses down from me. She‚Äôs sweet, quiet, and lives alone since her husband passed last year. I overheard her in the grocery store once saying she was skipping meals to make rent. That night broke me.

So I started small. Bread, milk, a few veggies. Then I added more ‚Äì eggs, fruit, even her favorite cookies (I asked her once in casual conversation what she liked most from her husband‚Äôs baking). I always wear a hoodie and go after 10 PM when she‚Äôs already in bed.

She doesn‚Äôt know it‚Äôs me. Last week I heard her tell another neighbor, ‚ÄúI think God sends someone to look after me. I call them my grocery angel.‚Äù

I‚Äôm not religious, but hearing that made me cry in my car for like 10 minutes. I‚Äôm not doing this for recognition. I just know what it‚Äôs like to be forgotten and alone.

I don‚Äôt need praise. I just needed to say this out loud.

I‚Äôm the grocery angel. And I‚Äôll keep showing up every Sunday.

My husband has worked for Microsoft for 25 years. He was just laid off ‚Äî randomly selected by a computer algorithm. His last day is this Friday ‚Äî his 48th birthday.

He is autistic and has multiple sclerosis. He‚Äôs the most quietly loyal, brilliant person I‚Äôve ever met. Never missed a day of work. Rarely called in sick (and would then work from home). Worked 60+ hours a week. Took on-call shifts during Christmas and Thanksgiving so coworkers with children could be home. He never asked for raises or promotions ‚Äî he just kept showing up and solving impossible problems.

He‚Äôs won awards for fixing multi-million-dollar bugs. He‚Äôs mentored hundreds of coworkers, including some who went on to lead teams and divisions. Even the CEOs knew his name. And yet he was let go ‚Äî by a spreadsheet.

He got his 25-year crystal a few months ago. Now he‚Äôs being walked out.

He would be so embarrassed if he knew I was writing this. He‚Äôs proud of keeping a stiff upper lip and not making a fuss. But I couldn‚Äôt let him leave without someone hearing the story.

I don‚Äôt need pity. I just need someone to know what this world does to the people who give it everything ‚Äî quietly, consistently, and without ever asking for more.

I absolutely hate having a very dark labia. The rest of my body is lighter (I‚Äôm light skinned black) but then my fucking labia is nearly BLACK. it‚Äôs so fucking unattractive especially when all u see online are light skin colored or pink labias. And it‚Äôs doctor‚Äôs offices/OBGYN offices. Every ‚Äúimage‚Äù or layout they have of vaginas are pink. It pisses me off and makes me insecure. 

Edit: Ik I have internalized self-hate and probably colorism due to growing up around all white ppl but I am in therapy and trying to deconstruct the mentally. It‚Äôs just weird bc if I were to hear anyone else, especially another black woman, say this abt themselves I would be so quick to make sure they know it‚Äôs normal and beautiful but I just can‚Äôt say it abt myself. 

Edit 2: I just want to say thank you everyone who commented about the normalcy and that were vulnerable to share their experiences. I was feeling really insecure about something that‚Äôs honestly had me down for a while, and reading your words helped more than you probably realize. You made me feel normal and seen, and I‚Äôm really grateful for that. And I‚Äôm getting off of social media if yk what I mean.

I finally fell asleep on the couch at 5:30. I woke up at 8:10, went into the bedroom and climbed into bed. 

Boyfriend woke up, looked over at me, gave me a sleepy smile and ran his fingers through my hair. I fell asleep until about 11:22.

When I woke up I went out to the living room where he was taking a morning break (he's working from home today). He told me, "Goodmorning, sleepy head." I told him I had been up until 5:30. 

He was concerned and asked why. I told him after he woke me up I couldn't get back to sleep. He felt so bad and just kept apologizing. I told him he had nothing to apologize for because he didn't mean to wake me up. I could tell it still bothered him, though.

He just came back from the store (he was grabbing us lunch) and he surprised me with cinnamon rolls and some Reese's cups.

Yes, he is a sweetheart.

No, he didn't mean to wake me up.

Yes, he felt terrible about it.

I'm now a little more rested and I have treats to look forward to later so I consider this a win.

I‚Äôm keeping this short. My parents have both died. Mother when I was very little and father not too long ago. I‚Äôm 18. It‚Äôs just me and my older brother left. 

Although we promised we‚Äôd always be there for each other, he‚Äôs moving in with his girlfriend. A decision which I supported when he proposed it to me. 

I‚Äôve come to the conclusion, that on my roughly ¬£30k a year salary, I can‚Äôt afford to have this house and a decent quality of life. I‚Äôm left with nothing for myself at the end of each month. 

It‚Äôs the place I‚Äôve called home for my whole life and it‚Äôs all fallen apart. I have to get a new place. I‚Äôd hate to think of what my parents would say. They love this place more than I could, and I already do‚Ä¶ a lot.

Pretty self explanatory. I grew up on omegle as a young girl, so naturally I was exposed to tons of sexual content. This caused me to have a porn addiction from a very young age. Nowadays, I lost my virginity to my ex girlfriend last January. Then, when we broke up, within the same year during December I slept with my ex boyfriend. Whatever, it happens. I've been happy single recently, and I've absolutely learned to love myself since then. However, I still enjoy physical touch and the thought of being loved, so just a few weeks ago when I thought me and this guy were into each other, I sucked him off twice. He wasn't into me so he broke it off. It happens. But now, I'm always flirting with one of my coworkers. She's a really good friend of mine, but we honestly flirt so much I can't even tell if it's a joke or not. She's gorgeous, but I don't think I like her like that. Now I'm texting another coworker of mine, and we've become good friends. I'm starting to question whether or not I like him romantically, and the thought makes me feel like a whore. I feel like I keep going from person to person, but that isn't my intention at all. In fact, I like being single. I have time to myself and I constantly get to indulge in my interests. I don't know if I really like people romantically or if I just like the attention or what. Don't get me wrong, I wouldn't be opposed to dating someone, but I don't want to do it so soon right as I get over the guy I did things with. So yeah, I don't really know what I'm trying to gain from this, I just needed to get it off my chest.

So I‚Äôve got this friend I met while getting a professional degree. On the surface, he seems like a genuine and decent guy. But a while back, something happened that I‚Äôve never fully processed.

One weekend, he and another mutual friend hung out together. He has a wife and a small child at home, and they use Life360 or something similar to track each other‚Äôs locations. That night, he brought a *second phone*, left it at our mutual friend‚Äôs apartment, and the three of us went out. Later, he hooked up with a woman in his car that he met out that night.

He lives almost 2 hours away from me, but came down recently to "see what I was working on." I showed him around, we had lunch, and then hit a brewery after I was done with my work for the day. He met another woman there, got her Snapchat, and now says she wants to hang out again. He asked if he could come back next week and see her again, before or after hanging out with me. Then he asked me to send him a message saying I needed his help, I assume to show his wife as an excuse to make the trip sound legit.

I haven‚Äôt responded yet. I haven‚Äôt told him how uncomfortable all of this makes me feel. I‚Äôm not close with his wife at all, but I‚Äôm starting to feel like an accomplice.

I got good news today and wanted to share with somebody and realised I have no one to share it with. Got me kind of bummed me out but I want to celebrate anyway :) 

The good news: I got accepted to a PhD program I wanted to get into!

I've always seen my dad as this calm silent type who never let emotions take over. He‚Äôs the kind of man who quietly does everything for everyone, fixes things, pays bills, picks up the slack, but never says much about how he feels. I honestly don‚Äôt remember a single time growing up when he raised his voice or shed a tear. He was just‚Ä¶ solid.

A few nights ago I was walking past his room and heard him talking on the phone in a low voice. I don‚Äôt know what made me stop, maybe it was how off his voice sounded. And then I heard him choke up, full-on sobbing. It wasn‚Äôt loud but it was the kind of cry that breaks through someone‚Äôs chest when they‚Äôve been holding it in for too long. I froze.

I know I should‚Äôve walked away but I didn‚Äôt. I just stood there listening to this man, my father, break down. He was talking to someone, maybe a sibling, maybe a friend, I don‚Äôt know. He said things like ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how much longer I can pretend everything‚Äôs okay‚Äù and ‚ÄúI feel like I‚Äôm failing everyone.‚Äù

I couldn‚Äôt sleep that night. I still can‚Äôt. He acted normal at breakfast the next day like nothing happened. And I just sat there wondering how many times he‚Äôs felt this way and none of us knew.

I feel guilty for eavesdropping. I feel sad that he‚Äôs hurting. And I feel angry at myself for never thinking about what he might be carrying all this time. I don‚Äôt even know if I should say anything or just give him the space he clearly wanted. But the image of him crying won‚Äôt leave me.

I needed to get this off my chest. If you‚Äôve ever seen your parents like this, raw, vulnerable, human, how did you handle it? Did you talk to them about it or just carry it with you?

I‚Äôm in a mood where I want to gush about my best friend, so I decided to do it here.

My best friend is a man I‚Äôve known since we were both in diapers. He is one of the genuinely best people you will ever meet. He is so kind and considerate, and he is not a doormat. I consider him an older brother and a platonic soulmate of sorts. I love him to death, and he knows it.

In a clear sign that we are not 8 anymore, my friend graduated from college last week. Between finals and fraternity events, he has legitimately dropped off the grid. I sent him a text letting him know that I remembered and I have a gift for him, but I‚Äôm waiting to hear back before I text him again.

I am just... so damn proud of him. I legitimately think he is going to go far in life, he‚Äôs naturally likable and ambitious. I feel incredibly lucky to call him my friend, and I wish we had more genuinely good people like him in the world.

Not gonna lie, I‚Äôve been missing him a bit. But I know he‚Äôll be back eventually.

I work at a tech startup company, all of the employees here (7i including manager) are developers and programmers across different fields.

two months after I got hired they brought in a new guy, and when i tell you whatever the stereotype is about CS students who smell bad, HE SMELLS WORST,

GOOD GOD, I CANT'T even begin to describe how dirty this mf is , he is so dirty to the point where you would know when he showered, because it happened once a month or so and its the only time where he wouldn't smell like a rotting corpse,

He is a dweeb down to the core who flexes watching hundreds of anime, who hates showers because "they are annoying" FFS

His entire existence is about anime and Japanese culture. It's ok to be amused by a culture, IT'S NOT OKAY TO MAKE IT UR ENTIRE FUCKING PERSONALITY
HE KEEPS talking about wanting to marry an Asian girl, move to japan and find a job there, visit japan, learning to write and read Japanese on fucking DUOLINGO,

he is annoying down to the core, I hate him with every atom in my body. he is cringe and unfunny, he is a know-it-all, who happens to have a 10 year experience on every fucking subject from the depths of AI to S*x which he admits to being a virgin (what a shocker),

HE FARTS IN THE OFFICE, not in the bathroom, IN THE FUCKING OFFICE SPACE, like dude it smells like something crawled up your ass and died, we have made it very clear that we know, we even accused him a few times of the horrid smell as a joke, we bought air fresheners (PLURAL).

and the moment he sets foot in the bathroom YOU KNOW SOMETHING'S GOINH DOWN, the bathroom aint even that close to the office space and we can smell everything.
 
yesterday he blamed the "DRY AIR" on the smell of his fart i mean for the love of god either buy a butt plug to stop whatever death smell factory u have, or please QUIT and let us live

Girlfriend cheated on me while out of town on a work trip.

Title kinda says it all. My ‚Äò24F‚Äô GF cheated on me ‚Äò26M‚Äô, while I was out of town on a work trip. We had a baby very early on in our relationship. We have been together a little over two years and have a one year old boy. He is just the absolute greatest thing. That makes this all the more tough.

When I took my new job on, she became a SAHM. I travel out of town very frequently for work, and this caused a sort of divide between us. We just struggle so much and so often to settle conflict and disputes over the phone. Something so small is just blown so out of proportion. And then if I get home and something new happens, it just call compounds. Anyways, two days ago she sent me a screenshot from a message I had sent to someone I used to mess around with. It is from over three years ago, and it‚Äôs basically me cutting it off with her. She asked me if I pretty much still cared about her? And I said ‚ÄúI guess I hope she‚Äôs doing well.‚Äù She immediately said she‚Äôs having a guy over,we‚Äôre broken up, went and dropped our son off within a few hours, and lo and behold, she fucked someone in our home. We have pictures of us all over, family photos, in our room, on my nightstand, our dresser. In our bed. Our sons room down the hall, it just makes me so sick to my stomach. We took family photos for Mother‚Äôs Day on Saturday at a brunch. I just struggle so much to understand how she could do this to me. And how she could be so open about it and act like it‚Äôs FINE!!! I just cannot fathom how she flipped so fast.  Whether together or not, it‚Äôs the fact that we all live here together and she wholeheartedly thinks it‚Äôs okay to do that. She says because we were broken up (5 hours prior to her cheating), that it‚Äôs not considered cheating. Her family owns the place we live in, and I‚Äôm not in contact with my family for personal reasons. Her family has made it abundantly clear they did not purchase this place for one or the other of us, it was bought with us as a family in mind. I am worried if one of us goes, we all have to go. So I just don‚Äôt know what to do. How could I stay here, continue to stay here, acting like things are fine and dandy while she is out cheating in everyone‚Äôs eyes but hers. I am just at such a loss. Such a loss. I got home today and can‚Äôt even look at her. She gaslights me and says if I bring it up as cheating again that I can ‚Äúget out of her house‚Äù. That I pay bankroll to live in and keep the lights on at and the two car garage with two cars. I just really don‚Äôt know what to do. At a loss I guess. Hard pill to swallow. Just one of those things I‚Äôll rack my brain on forever.

I‚Äôm really not a neat freak. I just want a reasonably clean bed.

In the decade+ we‚Äôve lived together, he has never washed our sheets. If I never did it, it would never get done. I had a major injury a couple years ago and I was quite literally crawling and hopping around the house to get housework done for months. The *only* thing I asked is that he change and wash our sheets regularly. It didn‚Äôt happen even once.

He lets our kids eat in our bed even though I‚Äôve asked him not to several times. He‚Äôs laying on his side of the bed, so the kids (and the crumbs) end up on my side.

We recently got a dog and I was very clear before we got it that I just didn‚Äôt want it in the bed. I thought he would respect that‚Ä¶ and I was wrong. It‚Äôs been here less than a week and it‚Äôs already been in our bed several times. He kept defending by saying it was only on his side. Well the dog has been walking around in mud all day today and I just went up to see that it was nice and cozy on MY side of the bed.

I grabbed my pillow and walked out. Tonight and every night for the foreseeable future, I‚Äôll be sleeping in the cold basement.

If he‚Äôs going to insist that it be allowed on the bed (MY side of the bed it seems), I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôll ever go back to sleeping in it. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs too much to ask to not sleep in crumbs and mud.

The worst part is that everyone else in the house has their own space. My husband has an office. Everyone else has their own bedrooms. I don‚Äôt have one room in this house where I can have dedicated privacy. Sometimes I just hole up in our closet.

I‚Äôm so sad. I just want some space.

i failed my calculus exam what the fuck i got a 37/60 fuck this shit i need to get better grades the entire world is burning down i gotta somehow carry my weight ü´°this is a message to people who are also failing in life, you have time to recuperate your losses you just need to start NOW!!!!!!!!!

That biopsy *hurts*.  Damn.  They put me under and got to it through my colon wall, up my butt.  Feels like a turd pulled a switchblade on the way out.  Hurts like hell to fart.  Ghaaaa.

I know how bad a cancer fight can be.  This is my wife, I'm her caretaker:

https://imgur.com/gallery/n7xSe2V

That's from a year ago.  She's still cancer free after they radiated the bone tumor.  Problem is, her cancer feeds on estrogen and she's been on monthly estrogen suppression shots...which are slowly killing her.  She thinks she's tapped out on those, she's coming off them, which increases her risk of it coming back.

Both of us completely lack other family support.  All we have is each other.  And now I've got three weeks of more worry plus a big pain in the ass.

Sigh.

Last week was my 27th birthday. Not a single text, no calls, nothing on Facebook. I just sat in my room, watching the time hit midnight, feeling like no one even noticed.

Strangely, I wasn‚Äôt even super sad. Just kinda empty. I always remember other people‚Äôs birthdays, message them, sometimes even plan stuff. But I didn‚Äôt really expect anything back this year.

Anyway, around 8 at night, someone knocked on my door. I live alone and didn‚Äôt order anything, so I was confused. I opened it, and there was my neighbour, Mrs Jensen (she‚Äôs about 70) holding a slice of cake and a little birthday card.

She smiled and said, ‚ÄúYou said it was your birthday in the lift the other day, yeah? Just thought I‚Äôd let you know someone cares.‚Äù

Honestly, I nearly cried. We ended up sitting outside on the porch for a bit, chatting. She told me about her husband who passed away, and we just had a really nice talk.

It wasn‚Äôt about the cake. It was just... nice to feel seen, y‚Äôknow? Like, someone actually noticed me.

Mrs Jensen honestly made my whole year.

18M now

Life was good before 2019. I was enjoying high school. I had friends, I was doing okay, and nobody treated me like I was worthless. But after my grandma left in November 2019, things started going downhill. Then the pandemic hit, and by 2020 to 2021, my family had clearly given up on me.

I dropped out in 2021. I was 15. I didn‚Äôt enroll that year because I didn‚Äôt like the modular learning system. But the following years‚Äî2022 and 2023‚ÄîI was begging everyone to help me get back into school. Nobody helped. People who once promised to support my education just vanished. They didn‚Äôt care. I watched the people I grew up with in school move forward and graduate. Meanwhile, I was stuck, desperate to be given another chance.

The worst was the summer of 2021. My family left for a months-long vacation to my grandfather‚Äôs province, and I was left behind with my negligent, alcoholic father. They said I couldn‚Äôt go because ‚Äúno one would take care of me,‚Äù but then just left me to rot at home. I had no clean laundry, no guidance, no support. Sometimes I didn‚Äôt even have clean underwear for weeks. I didn‚Äôt know how to manage anything, and I missed out on basic things like developing social skills or feeling like part of a family.

Between 2021 and late 2023, I was just stuck at home being yelled at almost daily by my sister, I was afraid to go out because I was afraid people might judge me, I didn't even go out my room sometimes when my sister is there to avoid conflict, I was constantly excluded from things. I felt like I didn‚Äôt belong anywhere, like I had to force myself into cousin groups just to be included, while others got to naturally enjoy family events. I cried after family gatherings, not because I was dramatic‚Äîbut because I genuinely felt unwanted.

And then there was my older brother. When he got diagnosed with depression, he was showered with attention‚Äîan iPhone, a laptop, private school tuition all paid for by our aunt. But when I was struggling? When I was breaking down quietly in my room every night? No one did anything. I was starving for even a sliver of support. At one point, I was so desperate I thought about hurting myself‚Äîbotching a suicide attempt just to get someone to notice. But I was scared of death, so I didn‚Äôt go through with it. I just stayed invisible.

Then in November 2023, I got sick. I couldn‚Äôt swallow food. I didn‚Äôt eat for two weeks and barely drank water. I started losing weight rapidly, getting weaker. It might have been GERD or LPR‚Äîsomething affected my esophagus. It became psychological. Even when there was nothing physically wrong anymore, I still couldn‚Äôt eat properly. People started blaming me: ‚ÄúWhy can‚Äôt you just swallow your food?‚Äù like it was a choice. Nobody brought me to a hospital. I begged for a day or two when I got a urinary tract infection on top of it. That‚Äôs when they finally reached out to my extended family.

It wasn‚Äôt my parents or siblings who helped. It was my extended relatives who stepped in. They paid for everything. They got me treatment. I moved in with my grandma during recovery. Ironically, the family dog in the house I left died of malnutrition a year later.

Eventually, someone new came into my father‚Äôs life, and she persuaded him to enroll me in ALS for Junior High in 2024. That‚Äôs the only reason I‚Äôm back in school now. Meanwhile, my classmates from the past already finished all six years of high school. I still have two more to go. But at least I‚Äôm back.

And now, just recently, I got into a fight with my sister. I was asking her calmly how to process my documents for the SHS voucher program. She kept interrupting me and whining, ‚ÄúAsk someone else.‚Äù I kept trying to finish explaining politely until I finally yelled, ‚ÄúCAN‚ÄôT YOU LET ME FINISH EXPLAINING?‚Äù Suddenly I was the disrespectful one. She stormed off yelling, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll all be nothing without me,‚Äù like she hadn‚Äôt been yelling at me for years or pretending to be a saint to our relatives on the phone. I yelled back ‚ÄúSANTO SANTOAN‚Äù because I was tired of her fake behavior, tired of being the villain in everyone‚Äôs eyes. Then I lost it. I yelled and pointed at her ‚ÄúFOR YEARS I WANTED TO KILL MYSELF‚ÄîDAY AND NIGHT. YOU TREATED ME LIKE A DOG.‚Äù

Now she‚Äôs wondering why I‚Äôm ‚Äòdisrespectful‚Äô to her after everything.

I'll be completely honest, I asked chatgpt to summarize the story my late teens, I was starting forget details of it, theres too many that I could've missed some details, and it just so happens that I used chatgpt to vent about my past, which I sometimes cry about, so I figured maybe it's time other people know about my story, nobody around me knows my story, because everybody will just invalidated it.

I'm so proud of her. She has always been interested in her field of study and was over the moon when she was accepted. It's a Top 10 university in our state and her program ranks 13 in the country. What makes me even more proud is that it's an integrated program, meaning she'll earn both her bachelor's and master's degrees in just 5 years. The school is expensive. Tuition is higher than the national average for both private and public schools. She received a very generous merit scholarship, which is an absolute blessing, but I have no idea how I'm going to pay the rest. I'm doing everything I can to not let my worries dull her excitement, but it's hard. She's applied for dozens of scholarships, but we're from a lower income area, so there is lots of competition. Unfortunately, she was did not receive any of them. As soon as she was accepted, I picked up a part-time job but it won't be nearly enough. I'm currently working on getting another part-time job and I'm just going to keep doing my best to support her.

Throwaway acct. I woke up one day. Half my vocabulary was gone. My words were extremely basic. If someone said something complicated, I got lost and couldn't understand them. I couldn't process or visualize what they said.

I tried to code (I'm a programmer), and immediately passed out with each attempt for about six months until I decided to just teach myself to code all over again from "Hello World". 

I used to be a math wiz. Now I struggle to remember my times tables. I had to relearn how to do napkin math.

I kept choking on beverages. My voice was deeper for a little while. My metabolic rate is about 500 under my estimated metabolic rate for my height/weight/age. Basically if I eat over 1k calories, I gain.

I suffered chronic pain for years after that fateful moment and had poor emotional regulation. I get mad so easily now. I'm like a grumpy old person at 35. I have little tolerance for people, public spaces, impromptu gatherings, etc. I get really flustered and overwhelmed at people showing up unexpected. Everything has to be scheduled and prepared for.

I have to batch my thoughts now. Before I get up, I have to think about everything that I need to do in order to get whatever I need to done. If I'm cooking, I mentally cooked the entire meal before I even got up and then I just put myself on autopilot and do it.

I get lost without my GPS. Doesn't matter how many times/months I walked to Starbucks, still won't know where it is or which direction to walk.

I lost passion for my hobbies. I lost my passion for coding. I'm rather emotionally detached and my sex drive is nonexistent. 

The irony is that I'm now a way better programmer now than I ever was (dunno why). And I practiced really hard on my articulation, but it all goes out the window when I'm presenting at work or being put on the spot. And I keep blurting similar, but wrong words (like redacted when I meant retracted for example).

I developed rumination OCD. I went through really weird stages of uncontrollable crying and anxiety.

But yeah like I said, no one believes me. My fianc√© didn't notice because they were busy. My parents didn't notice either or think anything of my symptoms. I made mention of them as they were happening, but everyone acted casually like "oh that's strange." I saw doctors, about some of the symptoms and they would order bloodwork which came back normal. 

I didn't know I had a stroke until recently. I was watching Blacklist and Agent Navabi was looking up aphasia. On the wiki page it mentioned stroke as a cause, and it all flashed before my eyes. 

I went to see a doctor, did an MRI, but I guess I waited too long because my brain looked normal to them. So the doctor tried to tell me inspite of all of the above that I probably didn't have a stroke. I did find out I have habitually low blood pressure (like 90/60) and possibly narcolepsy though.

Everyone I tell asks "well what did the doctor say?" As if my own account of the past 5/6 years isn't enough.

But I know I had a stroke.

Found out my friend of 5 years is secretly loaded and I'm lowkey freaking out!  
  
We've been tight since college like splitting bills, taking turns buying drinks, pilling up some dollars to bet on Stake sports parlay or sometimes even stressing about money together.  
  
This weekend I went to his place and his neighbor casually mentioned "he's probably at his lake house'.. Some light social media digging revealed his family owns a massive company and he's basically a multi-millionaire.  
  
I'm not mad he hasn't been funding our friendship like I'm confused why he's been pretending to be broke! He's seen me stress about money countless times and said nothing.  
  
Now I'm overthinking everything. Does he think we'd treat him differently? (probably) Is he scared people just want him for his money? (fair) But also, we're supposed to be close friends and he's hiding a massive part of his life.  
  
Do I say something? Pretend I don't know? Anyone else discovered their friend was living a secret rich life?

I held your guitar today. And it wasn‚Äôt just wood and strings‚Äîit was you. It was a piece of you I could still touch. Still hold. Still feel in my hands when everything else felt too far away.

Your old friend gave it to me a few years ago‚Äîsaid it was mine. And I carried it like a sacred promise. But when I moved out of his house recently, he changed his mind. Said I shouldn‚Äôt have it. Took it back. Just like that.

I wanted to scream. But I didn‚Äôt. I walked. And I think you would‚Äôve been proud of that.

Because I‚Äôm trying, Dad. I‚Äôm trying to be the kind of man you would‚Äôve wanted me to become. I‚Äôm not perfect. I‚Äôve messed up. But I‚Äôm learning to say I was wrong. I‚Äôm learning to choose love even when it shakes my voice.

You died when I was just a boy. But I‚Äôve carried your shadow every day since. Now I want to carry your light.

That guitar will never just be an object. It‚Äôs a promise. To keep walking with love. To keep playing my truth‚Äîno matter who tries to silence it.

I love you. And I hope you see me now.

I originally posted this on my own Reddit page, but no one really saw it. I‚Äôm not looking for attention‚Äîjust sharing something that still hurts. I had to leave my last place because my roommate was psycho. I basically grabbed what I could and left. I wasn't on the lease so I didn't have to deal with that.i stayed in my car during the weekdays and hotels on the weekends..  a couple mo ths ago I went through a program at the VA for menfal health and I feel like I have a new lease on life. The VA directed me to a community program and it helped me get into a place. I went from every other week to weekends at a hotel with my daughter and now I can have her as much as I did before. I feel like my life is finally coming together. However, I always have this constant fear that the other shoe is gonna drop. I've been abused most of my life and so I never expect good things to fall in line. Guess it's a defense mechanism from my childhood. That program made me feel like my life is finally in my control but in the back of my mind I'm always expecting it to fall down all around me.

That‚Äôs it, basically. I finally really like somebody and it feels like I‚Äôm in high school again! Honestly, I thought I lost the ability to like someone after my ex. It‚Äôs been about three years and even though I have been seeing people, I never really felt that /spark/, you know? I did like these people, but I always felt somewhat indifferent towards them. Like if they were to ghost me, it wouldn‚Äôt bother me all that much. It made me really sad because I do love being in love. 

Anyway, I met this guy back in October and we‚Äôve been in contact since then, but for the past two weeks we‚Äôve been talking a lot more - I‚Äôm talking facetiming for hours and texting every single day. And I‚Äôve noticed myself looking forward to his calls/texts, I‚Äôm thinking about him all the time, I talk to my friends about him a lot, I like to stare at pictures of him when we‚Äôre not talking (creepy I know) and honestly it feels really good. It‚Äôs definitely kinda scary because I don‚Äôt wanna get hurt, but I love feeling this way about somebody!

Only problem here though is the fact that he lives in another state and is in a pretty popular band so he‚Äôs /always/ on tour, meaning he‚Äôs constantly surrounded by beautiful women so I do get kinda jealous. It drives me crazy, but the fact that it drives me crazy makes me kinda happy?

He‚Äôs flying me out to his state for a week as a birthday present and I am so excited. I LOVE HAVING A CRUSH!!!

I feel like I‚Äôve been annoying my friends with this so I just needed to get that off my chest somewhere haha knowing I can still have feelings for somebody is awesome

This is long, but I need to get it off my chest and shout into the void. 

My mom (early 50s) met her now-husband (H, late 40s) seven years ago. My mom swore off ever marrying again after her divorce from my dad, but in her words, it was a whirlwind romance. H moved in pretty quickly after their first meeting and they were married within 16 months. At the start, he seemed fine - odd, but nothing alarming. He was nice enough to me (28F) and my two younger sisters (now 22F and 20F), who live with my mom. But slowly, the red flags began piling up. 

Since they got together, H has never held a stable job. He's started and abandoned multiple businesses - all funded by my mom. She bought him a run-down apartment to renovate, funded his woodwork and renovation ventures, and paid for every tool, gadget, motorcycles (multiple), phones, and even gave him her BMW that he eventually ran into the ground. He has full time access to her credit card, is on her medical insurance (that he drains almost every year through injuries and infections), is in her will, and has basically become a full-time dependent. 

He contributes absolutely nothing. But the real damage isn't financial - it's emotional and mental. 

He regularly antagonises my younger sisters. He picks fights with them over small things like them using his towel or not filling the dishwasher - usually over the family Whatsapp group and through extremely passive aggressive comments. Every time he plays the victim and convinces my mom he's being bullied by them. And then my mom turns around and demands *they* fix things. 

This has been the cycle for years. Then, in January this year, things started taking a more disturbing turn. A petty argument over towels blew up. My sisters called me to vent (I live across the country from them). One of them, clearly exhausted, sarcastically said "Do you think I could get away with murder?" She's five feet tall and weighs 50kgs. It was a joke. But H was eavesdropping - and ran to my mom crying, saying they were plotting to kill him. My mom ended up having a breakdown and sent them to stay with me for a week. Not sure why they were the ones who had to be cast out but I digress. Upon them returning they were expected to put it all behind them, not really resolve the issue and just move forward. 

After that, I tried to reestablish normal contact with my mom. We usually have a phone call once a week on a Wednesday to chat and catch up. One week in March, we moved our usual Wednesday call to the Thursday - off our normal routine (this is important for later). During this conversation, my mom and I spoke privately about a small disagreement she's had with H about one of my sisters - nothing major. Later that day, I got a message from H referencing that exact call. He accused me of meddling and warned that he's "reciprocate". But he couldn't have known a) that we even spoke that day and b) what we talked about unless he somehow listened to that conversation. (For context, my mom calls me while she drives to work, alone, in her car. There was nobody around her and I was home alone). I immediately spoke to my mom and we were freaked out. She checked her car and phone for any listening device and found his tablet on her backseat. We realised it might have been used as a listening device since it's connected to H's phone but we don't know for sure. Regardless somehow he knew exactly about that conversation. 

Then, in April, things escalated. H confronted my sister's boyfriend with information from a private Whatsapp chat between them. He even produced a screenshot showing that my sister had exported her chat and emailed it to H - something she had never and would never do, she didn't even know it was possible. A quick scan proved this screenshot to be fake, he was threatened by my sister with legal action for privacy violations and H dropped it immediately. 

I encouraged my sister to speak to my mom, believing she would take it seriously considering the privacy violation we experienced with him (to my knowledge, my mom didn't do anything about him listening to our phone call but because that happened I thought she would understand my sister's violation). About two weeks ago, my sister did in fact tell my mom, and for the first time in years my mom started to realise something was very wrong - or so I hoped. 

For the entirety of last week I spoke to my mom daily (we have the kind of relationship where she tells me everything) while she was figuring out what to do. She decided the best course of action was to see a psychologist, explain the situation and then book a follow up appointment that she would take H to to confront him with an unbiased third party present. I cannot explain the level of paranoia that followed myself, my sisters and my mom the whole of last week - it felt like no conversation was private no matter where we spoke. It felt like he was somehow monitoring us all. 

Following on from her first session with the psychologist, he basically said that he believes H is a narcissist, emotionally manipulative and isolating her from her children - and that she needs to get out of this relationship. Things that in all honesty we have all thought for a long time (it was quite validating to hear that a licensed professional thought the same). The next day, she told me she is booking the next session for her and H to go together, and *one minute later* he suggested the exact same thing to her. The timing was too perfect, it felt like even more confirmation that he was in fact somehow monitoring my mom's conversations. It's almost too much of a coincidence. 

This led to a major argument between them. After a three hour long conversation between them, suddenly everything was back to "normal". Perfect, happy couple. I immediately knew what happened. He had wrapped his excuses up in a pretty little box that my mom happily accepted, and he used my sister's chats against her to hurt my mom and turn my sister into the villain. 

On Mother's Day this past Sunday, my sisters joined them for dinner. Afterward, my mom pulled out her phone and read a list of "house rules" her and H had found online. She then gave my sisters the chance to suggest their own. It was clearly a trap - an excuse to confront my sister about the things she'd said in her private messages about my mom. Another plaster on a gaping wound without actually addressing the issue. When asked how he got access to her chats, H explained that he had gone into her phone when she left it open and charging one day in her bedroom when she had gone out. He admitted to reading her private chats (probably sent them to himself or took screenshots) and said he'd do it again. And I know it wasn't just the conversation between my sister and her boyfriend that he read - he read mine and hers too. He only apologised after being pushed by my mom - and even then, it was half-hearted. 

When I confronted my mom about how he knew about our phone call conversation, she said "he knows we usually speak on Wednesday's". But our call had been on a Thursday for that particular conversation. I immediately called out the lie and she put the phone down on me and refused to talk to me - ignoring it and letting it go. 

Now we're back where we started, if not worse. My sisters are emotionally exhausted. I'm emotionally exhausted. My mom insists we'll all leave her someday and clings to H for dear life. Meanwhile, she pushes us further away. There's never real resolution - just silence, denial, and more manipulation. 

I'm moving to another country soon, and I don't even want to go home before I leave. I feel like he's systematically trying to destroy our relationships so he can have full control over my mom - and her finances. My mom swears she'd never choose a man over her kids, but she has - again and again and again. 

H is controlling, manipulative, and invasive. I truly believe he's trying to isolate my mom - he's found someone kind, successful and vulnerable, and latched on. We've tried to show her the truth but she doesn't want to see it.

I don‚Äôt have anyone to tell this too, so, here it goes. I‚Äôm getting published! Here‚Äôs to hoping it hits shelves by mid-October ‚ô•Ô∏è

I had just fallen asleep when he woke me up by trying to cover my feet with the blanket. (He had brushed my feet with his hand and it woke me with a start).

I didn't want them covered.

I was completely fine as I was.

I am so tired right now.

He's back in the bedroom, sleeping like a frickin' baby right now.

Deep down inside, in that dark little place where my evil side dwells, I'm thinking up multiple scenarios where I wake him up. 

I won't do it, of course, because that would be rude. But, ugh, I am *so tempted.*

So this is a heavy one. I (27 Muslim F) was sexually abused by my father‚Äôs half-brother from ages 3-12. 

Growing up in a Muslim family, talking about sex or the body was taboo. Because of that, I didn‚Äôt fully understand what was happening to me until we had sex ED at school.

At 17, I finally told my family(except my dad) and one of my aunts and cousins. But nothing really changed.

For the past 10 years, I‚Äôve been tormented at every family gathering, party, or outing, because I still have to see his face. I have to act like he didn‚Äôt steal my entire childhood. I feel disgusted, ashamed, and guilty - but whenever I get upset after a party, I‚Äôm told I‚Äôm being dramatic.

I‚Äôm in specialized therapy now, and while it‚Äôs helping, it‚Äôs also made me more sensitive and angry. 
Just last week, my family went to his house, and when they came back, I was furious. It felt like they brought his ‚Äúgerms‚Äù back with them, like the whole house was contaminated.

I‚Äôve been trying to express how I feel, but I keep hearing things like:
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre a big family, we can‚Äôt do anything about it.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe have to keep our values, traditions, and culture alive. We can‚Äôt cut one person off without cutting everyone off.‚Äù

I get it, I really do. I‚Äôm not asking them to go public and tell everyone. 
I just wish they‚Äôd show more understanding. Maybe even find ways to avoid bringing him or his family into our space.

I‚Äôm so tired of feeling like I‚Äôm the problem. Like I‚Äôm the one ruining everything just because I‚Äôm hurt.

What would you do if you were in my situation?

VENT: My birth mom (BM) was chaos with a pulse. I was born into a situation that could best be described as a soap opera speedrun‚Äîan affair, a surprise baby (me), and a whole lot of denial. She neglected me badly‚Äîlike, diapers-optional, food-who? kind of badly. Eventually, someone stepped in and I was adopted around age 4. Thank god, honestly. My adoptive parents weren‚Äôt perfect, but they showed up. They tried. That alone changed everything.

But even though I haven‚Äôt seen BM in ages, the damage lingers. I hoard food. I have consistent issues with my bodily waste systems. I‚Äôm suspicious of anyone who says they love me. I‚Äôve spent most of my adult life trying to unlearn lessons I never asked to be taught. And now that I'm older, it‚Äôs like‚Ä¶ the anger is still here, but it‚Äôs heavy. I‚Äôm tired of carrying it.

I don‚Äôt need a relationship with her. I don‚Äôt want one. But I also don‚Äôt want to let her live rent-free in my head forever. I know forgiveness is for me, not her‚Äîbut how do you even begin that process when the hurt was so formative?

Anyway, if anyone‚Äôs figured out how to emotionally evict someone who hasn‚Äôt paid child support or psychological rent since 2004, let me know.

Thanks for reading. Advice, memes, whatever‚ÄîI‚Äôll take it.

I don‚Äôt even know where to start, but I just need to say it: I‚Äôm tired of being the strong one for everyone else. I‚Äôm the person people come to when they‚Äôre falling apart. Friends vent to me, coworkers pull me aside to unload, even my family leans on me whenever something goes wrong. I‚Äôm ‚Äúgood with words,‚Äù ‚Äúalways calm,‚Äù ‚Äúa great listener.‚Äù I‚Äôve heard it all.

But you know what? No one ever asks me how *I‚Äôm* doing. No one ever checks in unless they need something. And I don‚Äôt mean that in a self-pitying way ‚Äî it‚Äôs just the pattern I‚Äôve started noticing, and now I can‚Äôt unsee it.

I‚Äôve been going to the food bank for months now and usually walk there with a wagon because I don‚Äôt have a car. Today, a woman came up to me and asked, ‚ÄúWhere‚Äôs your car?‚Äù I told her, ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been doing this for months,‚Äù and she walked off for a bit.

Then she came back and asked, ‚ÄúAre there kids at home?‚Äù I said ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù and the lady who usually checks me in told her it‚Äôs just me. After that, she told me to go to the blue truck and asked if I knew where that was‚Äîeven though the truck was literally right in front of me. I said yes, but the whole thing felt weird.

It just felt like she assumed it was my first time or that I shouldn‚Äôt be there. I wasn‚Äôt doing anything wrong‚Äîjust trying to get some food like everyone else. Before I left with my food, she told me I should ‚Äúbring a car next time,‚Äù which honestly felt really rude and dismissive.

I‚Äôve never been questioned like that before, and it made me feel judged and uncomfortable. I‚Äôm doing my best, and this experience just left a bad feeling.

Thanks for letting me get this off my chest.

It's my (M25) first time visiting the Philippines since I left when I was 10. I was really only going here because of my sister's white coat ceremony. My stay here was supposed to be just a month of having fun until it ended with heartbreak yesterday.

To put into context, I'm not really too interested in a relationship before my 1 month vacation since I just really don't have the time, energy, and I'm honestly just not looking for one. So when I got here, meeting girls and going on dates was not part of my plan.

Eventually out of boredom, I downloaded dating apps. In the next couple of days, I've been already in multiple dates and hook-ups. One of the girls I dated is someone I'll call CB (F21).

CB and I spent our first time meeting each other pretty much just talking non-stop. At first she was pretty shy. My default language is English and my Filipino (Tagalog) is a bit rough. Her on the other hand was the complete opposite of me. So I did my best to speak in Filipino. We clicked instantly. We spent the entire day together and I really liked her. At the end of our first date, she ended up spending the night with me. 

Over the next few days (it's been a little over a week since my vacation started), me and CB were talking non-stop to each other. At this point, I was still regularly hooking up with other women. Then finally, me and CB's schedule matched up again and all we did on our 2nd date was go to dinner and hangout at my hotel after. Again we talked for hours just getting to know each other even more.

To keep an already super long story a tiny bit shorter, basically I ended up choosing to stop meeting other women after CB and I's second date. The more we talked the less I was interested in just having sex with her. She's currently on her semester break from her school. After our third date is really when I started to really have feelings for her. Yes it's a bit too soon but we spent our entire evening and morning (I let her sleep in my hotel since she lives over an hour away) just talking to each other. We didn't have sex or anything. We were just cuddling telling each other everything. She really was the sweetest girl I've ever met. She was telling me about how she wants to be a teacher and it's always been her dream even though it doesn't pay much. We practically told each other our entire life's story that night. Keep in mind this is the girl that barely said anything in our first date. She always said she's just really quiet but that night, she talked more than I did. 

Over the next 3 weeks, we spent as much time as we can seeing each other. I was smitten. If we're not together (when my sister lets me visit her at her dorm), we're texting on the phone constantly. She's told me that I'm the nicest person she ever met (I won't get into why she said that because it's long but the important thing here is that's how she sees me). We saw each other 11 times in less than 3 weeks. Keep in mind that she lives far away from where I'm at since she lives in the province and I'm at Manila. Since I don't know how to travel without rideshare, she comes to me instead.

The inevitable comes. We both knew this was coming. It's the last 5 days before I have to leave and get back to work. She decided that she'll spend as much time as she can with me. On the first day, I was coming from my sister's school and was travelling back to Manila. It was a long drive but when I got to my hotel, she was already waiting for me. Again we did the usual except the more I saw her, the lonelier I get. We do this for the next few days. 

On the 3rd day while we were saying our usual goodbyes in the morning, I embraced her for a long time. I thanked her for everything. She was laughing because she said it's weird that I'm acting like I wasn't going to see her again. The thing is she was kind of right. I didn't want to see her again. I don't know if I want an LDR. What if my mentality prior to meeting her comes back when I leave. I had all these things in my head for the past few days. The more I saw her, the more depressed I get. She even commented that I barely ate anymore and was not sleeping at all. I was getting confused about everything. I'm not even sure what we were at this point.

So she left not knowing I had no intention of seeing her again. I'm running at a total of 6 hours of sleep at this point in over 3 days. I still can't sleep or eat so I decided to go blow off some steam by going out. Big mistake because I ended up getting a fever. So back to bed I go. Around 4pm, I get a call from her. She told me she's looking forward to seeing me that night. I so badly wanted to say no. I'm sad about the possibility of not seeing her again, sad about going back to work, exhausted from lack of sleep, I've lost so much weight from barely eating anything, and to top if off, I have a fever. Still, I couldn't help but say yes. I wanted to see her. How I wish I could've just cancelled and told her I'll see her again tomorrow because I'm not in the right state of mind today.

So dinner is coming up. We're meeting at 7pm at my hotel and going out after (I made a reservation at a restaurant for 8pm). I have nothing in my stomach so I have to hold off on taking meds until at least she's close to getting here. So I wait. I get no text or calls from her at all. Eventually around 8:00pm, I get a call from her. She's telling me that she couldn't help but stop at the mall next to my hotel and go shopping. She is laughing as she says this. She then tells me she's about to pay so she hangs up. I never even got one word out. With everything that's going on with me and now this, I was honestly just ready to hit the bed. Around 9pm, she lets herself into my room (she knows the passcode). I wake up to her laughing and telling me about things. Out of frustration and everything that's been going on, the first thing that comes out of my mouth is that I asked her how long she's planning on staying here and when can she leave. She says she plans on staying overnight. So I told her then okay lets go to dinner... She told me she already ate when she was at the mall. I'm not proud of it at all and I wasn't in the mood anyways, I was just looking for someone to lash out on... I told her to take off her clothes and lets just have sex then. We both just sit down not saying anything to each other. I apologized to her and eventually she leaves.

Later that night, I texted her a heartfelt message (it's essentially an essay). Telling her how sorry I am and how even though I ruined it, meeting her was still the best thing that's ever happened to me in a long time, and more. She responds with "I don't know what to say." I tell her that it's okay and she doesn't have to say anything. I fucked up and not her. She doesn't have to accept my apology.

After that, I was a bit over it honestly. My brain is too fried to think about anything else. I'm ready to go back to my reality in the US. I wake up in the morning to a long text from her. She told me how she felt about what I said, how she thought I was different from every other guy, how I gave her hope about guys by being seemingly different from everyone else. She told me that I was the only guy to ever break her heart (usually she ends her previous relationships so she isn't too bothered by it) and she won't be fooled by anyone else ever again because she'll never trust men anymore. That I was just seeing her because she's attractive and all I cared about was sex. She then texts me a goodbye and to have a safe trip.

I replied to her apologizing again. Telling her that she should be glad she's rid of me and that I'm not worth another thought over. I've told her everything I needed to say in these two essays of an apology. I even told her that we met so many times yet I never initiated sex not even once. I was just really happy holding her hands and talking to her. Everything I was saying last night was just me looking for a fight.

I thought that would be the end of it because she highlights her reply from earlier where she says that she has nothing else to say to me anymore. For me that's fine, I'm a piece of shit and that's that. Me and her thought I was a good person but it turns out I can get nasty when I'm frustrated. I said what I needed to say and she doesn't have to accept my apology.

An hour passes and she sends me another message. She tells me how she hasn't slept and hasn't stopped crying since she left my hotel. Now I know her, she's shorter than me but she's always been a bit strong willed and I always saw her as the stronger person. The fact that I was making her cry that much was breaking my heart. I haven't cried at all so far but this message to me broke me. Thinking about her crying over me was too much for me. I needed to call her, she told me she doesn't want to talk to me or ever see me again. For me that's fine, I just wanted to tell her through voice or in-person that all the things I've been saying were genuine. That she's amazing and I'm a sensitive POS not worth crying over. I have never broken a girl's heart before. Shit I've never even hurt anyone like this before. So the thought that I hurt someone so much that they're crying over me was messing with me. I stopped messaging her when she told me she doesn't want to hear from me or see me ever again.

A few hours later I get a text from her. She tells me that she's about to be at my hotel. I asked her if she wants to come-in or if she wants to find a place outside where we can talk if she doesn't feel comfortable being in a room alone with me. She says that it's okay and she comes inside.

I couldn't even look at her, I told her to sit down and after a while I told her everything. Fuck it whatever but I was crying the entire time. Not because of the lost potential, because I honestly was over that fact already. I was crying because I couldn‚Äôt imagine myself ever hurting someone like that. It was the fact that she was crying over me that was affecting me that much. I hurt her so much yet she was still way too nice about it. She didn‚Äôt insult me or said anything unrelated to what happened to try to hurt me. Actually she didn‚Äôt even say anything at all. She just sat down and listened to me talk for over an hour. When it was clear I was done, she just said that she needed to go and she left.

After she left, I was also kind of over it too. I did what I could to show to her that nothing was wrong with her and that it was all me. I don‚Äôt even know why I‚Äôm writing this here. I guess I just need to tell people that I‚Äôm an asshole.

I'm sick. 

In the head, in my body (because of my head). 

I'm failing at everything and nobody cares, nobody wants to help, nobody wants to check in, nobody asks me to grab a coffee. 

I couldn't even lay it all out here and still maintain an audience but if I had to give a synopsis I would start with this year. I lived through an active shooting. My grandfather went on hospice. I moved. I stopped sleeping. I lost 30 lbs. I had a botched chiropractor appointment that caused an intense flair up of a genetic condition that's now causing daily, immobilizing pain. My small business is floundering. My partner talks about me to my friends, and not in a flattering way. I deserve some of the heat but I'm struggling and nobody cares. 

Full admittance that I'm a lot lately. My mood can turn on a dime. I usually feel somewhat helpless, other times I feel like a cheerleader for my nasty attitude. I crave attention. I don't go far enough to get any. I cry, a lot. I want to die but I'm scared to die. 

Per my genetic condition, the "fix" would be surgery. Surgery would fix my pain, fix my mood swings, fix my friendships? I can't see how surgery would make me less insufferable. I know I'm saying many words without much substance but the reality would bore you more. I'm here to get this off my chest. This weight of being horrible and being the only one who knows why. 

I'm a hypochondriac, it's all in my head, I'm over thinking it. The pain isn't real, the PTSD isn't there. Just take melatonin, it's a screen addiction, not insomnia. Other people have it worse. I know. I know. I know. But it's real to me. I'm hurting. Physically, mentally, and emotionally. But nobody cares and you won't either. I know I felt normal once. I can't remember when. Mostly now I just know I want an open casket. Maybe then people will finally see me.

I 18 (f) live with my parents and my two siblings, 14 (m) and 9 (f). One of my mom and dad‚Äôs friends is a guy I‚Äôll just refer to as S. S has always been very kind to me, saying I‚Äôm his favorite niece and making jokes with me, but I notice that it isn‚Äôt how he treats his own kids. He has three, all boys despite how much he wanted a girl. He treats the youngest one a bit more kindly since he‚Äôs autistic. 

I will admit, I‚Äôm scared. Not of him, but of the possibility that if I act or do something I‚Äôll lose him, a person who I‚Äôve loved ever since I was little. He‚Äôs dorky and funny but I can‚Äôt help but notice that the way he treats his kids isn‚Äôt right. I can give an example of this. 

Yesterday we were having a bonfire. His eldest went to another party but his two youngest were there. His youngest is a few years younger than my little sister. His son was trying to start the fire up again since it had died down but accidentally spread ashes all over us. My parents didn‚Äôt take it to heart, neither did I or my siblings. Frankly it was a little mistake that would just fly by in my family since generally we were having a good time and we would laugh about it at a later date. 

Not my uncle. My uncle got so mad he started yelling at his kid. This is the older one out of the two and he‚Äôs around the age where they start actually noticing their parent‚Äôs behavior. The kid practically begged my uncle to let him calm down after but my uncle wouldn‚Äôt let it go for a pretty good amount of time and whenever his wife tried to intervene to tell him that this is useless and to let his kid calm down my uncle would tell her to stop getting in his way. By this point, my parents would have told me that it‚Äôs okay and that I don‚Äôt need to cry. 

I tried taking his kid aside, but my uncle stopped me. The guilt is eating at me. The only thing I could do is at least give the youngest a blanket when he said he was tired and let him sleep a little on the couch. They‚Äôre all good kids, and GOD am I afraid of losing that family since I love and care for all of them deeply, but I don‚Äôt know what to do.

I don‚Äôt really know what to do. I wasn‚Äôt supposed to be in the office that late anyways, I simply stopped by, and he didn‚Äôt see me. I feel guilty not telling anyone about it, but I also don‚Äôt want to meddle in stuff that isn‚Äôt my business and end up causing trouble for myself at work. What do I do?

I was nine when my Dad took his own life. When it happened I felt so abandoned, and in the stupidest ways too because I was just a kid. I remember thinking ‚ÄúHow could he do that when we were all supposed to go to the zoo next month? We were supposed to look at the animals together and now we can‚Äôt,‚Äù as if that was the biggest thing he had chosen to miss. 

It didn‚Äôt help that everyone else walked away from me after that too. As it turns out when you‚Äôre a kid and your parent dies by suicide a lot of people don‚Äôt know how to deal with that so they just‚Ä¶don‚Äôt. My Mom‚Äôs side of the family, my classmates, my teachers, all of them pretty much stopped acknowledging I existed after what happened with my Dad, and my Mom was too busy dating a new guy every week to care about how I felt about any of it. 

So I was left alone and feeling like no one really wanted me as part of their life, other than my Aunt and Uncle on my Dad‚Äôs side who had been extremely flaky but willing to show up on occasion. It was so little effort now looking back on it. I only saw them about three times in the four years after he died, then it was basically radio silence after that, but those few moments of seeing them meant everything to me. They always seemed so excited to see me. It felt like they enjoyed having me as a part of their lives and I enjoyed them being a part of my life too. It didn‚Äôt matter that they were flaky because flakiness was still more effort than anyone else was showing me. 

It had been a few months since I spoke to them when they messaged me on social media to check in. My Aunt asked me how I was doing and I told her I was excited for my 13th birthday soon. She said she was excited for me and wished she could see me. We live in different states and she said that she simply couldn‚Äôt afford the trip at the moment but she wished there was a way that I could come to her. I said maybe there was since my Mom loves a good vacation, and that was that. Me and my Aunt added my Mom to a group text and arranged a trip to go see my Aunt and Uncle for my birthday. She seemed to excited over the phone, and kept telling me that she couldn‚Äôt wait to show me her newest projects (art) and take me all sorts of places. I felt really good about everything, and my notoriously flaky Aunt even stayed in contact with me up until the trip.

When we got in state to see her, she stopped responding. We texted her and texted her but she didn‚Äôt answer. Finally, on the day of my actual birthday, she finally bothered to text my Mom that she was sorry but that she just ‚Äúwasn‚Äôt feeling it.‚Äù She said work had been stressful and she just ‚Äúwasn‚Äôt feeling super sociable that week‚Äù and maybe we could try again to see for my next birthday but she was out for this one. She said my Uncle had bowed out as well since ‚Äúwork was hard for him too.‚Äù 

I cried so much afterwards. It wasn‚Äôt just not seeing them that hurt, it was realizing that there was really no one in my life who felt like I was worth the effort. I wasn‚Äôt worth the effort of living for, I wasn‚Äôt worth the effort of navigating a topic like suicide for, and I wasn‚Äôt worth showing up for either. It hurt then, and it still hurts now. 

I‚Äôve forgiven my Aunt and Uncle for not showing up. It is what is, and they were always flaky to begin with so I shouldn‚Äôt have put my hopes in them. But sometimes I think about what that moment represented and cry all over again. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm posting this. I just want to get it off my chest so I can let it go. I‚Äôve never told anyone in real life about these feelings and quite frankly I don‚Äôt want to because of how personal they are. But I do want to let them go, and this feels like as good of a space as any.

Suicide feels like the end game for me that must happen. Sometimes when i‚Äôm happy I stop myself and tell myself I HAVE to do it even if I don‚Äôt want to. I don‚Äôt know why. You would think that someone who is happy feels like living. But I don‚Äôt. I‚Äôm sad - suicide. I‚Äôm happy - suicide. 

Just a few months ago I used to not let myself watch things I like, like watching anime or playing games because those things would cheer me up and I wanted to make myself depressed. I don‚Äôt know if I struggle with depression because i don‚Äôt usually feel sad and i don‚Äôt often cry, so i forced myself to deprive myself of things I like so i can be sad and want to commit suicide even more. Suicide is something so hard to achieve for me, you know how people dream of being a doctor and it‚Äôs such a distant dream, to me that distant dream is suicide, it feels so out of my reach even though technically i could do it even now. 

There are moments where i‚Äôm more likely to try it, this year I failed one class and got on the bridge, i was so excited but suddenly got sick to my stomach I couldn‚Äôt even stand. Now my life is going well and i‚Äôm busy with work so I don‚Äôt even think of suicide as often and i don‚Äôt plan it or tell myself phrases (Whenever I plan suicide, I create a phrase like ‚ÄúI am going to get on the bridge and‚Ä¶‚Äù and I whisper or tell myself it in my head until my words don‚Äôt make any sense anymore, it‚Äôs a way of trying to assure myself i will do it) but as soon as i see an article about someone who killed themselves, see a video or a post or hear about it i want to die like that instantly. I do sometimes think oh i want to live on my own and get a car because i‚Äôm getting my driving license now, but there‚Äôs one thing i want more, suicide. I‚Äôm so excited to commit suicide one day, i watch those videos where people cry because someone committed suicide and read comments who are sad about it and i take so much pleasure in it, not that i‚Äôm happy the person died i‚Äôm just so excited to do it myself and receive this kind of care, i watch videos of people jumping from a high place and can‚Äôt wait for it to be me. Suicide feels like the only outcome and the most important thing is i don‚Äôt want it not to feel like it. When i feel happy i force myself to think that I do want to commit suicide. I don‚Äôt know why i‚Äôm so fixated on suicide but i am.

I‚Äôm not sharing this post to hear why life is worth living, i‚Äôve just been feeling like a crazy freak and i‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs often people feel this way. It‚Äôs just that i feel like suicide is my destiny. In my head it‚Äôs so beautiful, i get so excited thinking about how i would do it and the day after i do it when i wouldn‚Äôt be here anymore. It‚Äôs not that i don‚Äôt want to live, it‚Äôs more about the act.

When I was eleven I starved myself for about 3 weeks. Not because of my mom or my dad, not by bullies, no this was for my family, and for you to understand I need to tell you how I used to live...and still struggle to live. Growing up it was normal, middle class home with three siblings and my mom and dad, my oldest sister let's call her Hailey, (not her name) my second oldest sister Katie (not her name) me, and my littler brother Luke (not his name) lived with my great uncle in his one room apartment with our parents. We were living the best lives were could with a single parent working house hold and for a while it worked, small kids needing food but not a lot. And she spoiled us whenever she can. And being the youngest girl i was more spoiled, and Hailey didn't like that, because before i was born she was the spoiled one, always getting her way, so for taking her spot as spoiled kid she bullied me, relentlessly, growing up she always called me fat and unglt and call me names until i cried, and since mama was too busy working and my dad was too high and selfish to care i had to endure it. I couldnt even make friends because of her, she would bully me in front of them and hurt me to make me friend right in front of them so evening they stayed away from me. So i eventually after a while of her fatshaming me and bulyling me i believed it, and thought "why does it matter if i eat lots im already fat" so i just kept my weight, and grew up like that as a kid. But kids grow up and and so does our appetite. And soon when we were 12 to 7 years old we lived with my granny next. Growing up in her house was okay, she had three boys of her own living there so there was still always food in the fridge. We all went school, learned and grew up some more, and the time when I was 11, my sister Hailey 16 and Katie 14 and my baby brother 8 we finally got a place of our own. Meaning one parent working and my dad home cooking gambling and smoking Marijuana with my mom's hard earned money, it was rocky but my mom worked hard and kept us afloat. Until one week I noticed there was few foods in the fridge and in the cupboards. And I knew it wouldn't take long till it was gone before mom's paycheck, so I said it's fine, I can wait a few days. Since I just learnt fat is stored to subsequent your body just in case...and this was just in case lol so for three days I didn't eat, then on Friday I waited excitedly for my mom to shop and waited and waited...and waited and wondered why she didn't go shopping, and being distant with her i never asked her why, mainly because I didn't want her to know i wasn't eating, so I said "it's okay, it's just another few days I still have lots of fat" and soit was three weeks i didn't eat, I always made excuses and said I already ate. Everyone else did and I was happy. Because everyone got full, everyone didn't got hungry, everyone but me. Because I was the only fat one, but on the third week two days before my mom's payday i was in my room sitting in the dark, and all I could think was "I'm so hungry....why can't anyone see that? It's okay though, just two more days but I'm so hungry." Right then my mom was passing my room  and smiled at me saying "You lost so much weight! My daughter I'm so proud of you!" And passed my room, I cried. I closed my door and cried asking her in my mind "why can't you see I'm so hungry mom? Why haven't you noticed i haven't ate in three weeks?" But don't worry. I ate on her payday and made it somewhat worth it. To me at least

Hi Reddit, this is only my second post, but I‚Äôve got something on my mind that keeps playing over and over. I‚Äôm hoping to get some outside perspective‚Äîor at least some support.

I had a best friend from first grade. We instantly clicked and stayed close even when I switched school districts. We went through a lot together, including the worst night of our lives‚Äîa traumatic event that left me with PTSD. But even with the weight of that night hanging over us, we stayed close. We were each other‚Äôs safe space when the memories came back.

As we got older, we took different paths. She finished college and started her career; I got married and started a family. When she met the love of her life at 33, I was so happy. I was excited to share the "mom life" with her since my youngest is just a couple years older than her daughter.

At her daughter‚Äôs first birthday party, everything seemed fine. I knew she was mixing different friend groups, so I mostly hung out with her family, who I was really close with. Then‚Ä¶ nothing. Weeks went by. Then months. I chalked it up to new motherhood, her busy life, and COVID. But eventually, I started spiraling, wondering what I‚Äôd done wrong.

There was one small thing‚ÄîI once found an ovulation test in her bathroom (not snooping, just using it because the other was occupied). I mentioned it in private because I was excited for her. Maybe that was it? I also vape, and though I never did it inside and quit smoking during my pregnancies, maybe that bothered her?

I ended up sending her a long, heartfelt message apologizing for anything I might‚Äôve done. No response. And that was it. Years went by.

Losing her gutted me. We were friends for nearly three decades and she just‚Ä¶ ghosted. I‚Äôve got abandonment issues thanks to a pretty rocky childhood, and this hit hard. I started pulling away from other people. I pushed friends out before they could leave me. I isolated. I told myself I was fine being alone‚Äîbut really, I just didn‚Äôt want to feel that pain again.

Then, out of nowhere, I got a message from her at 2 a.m. after four years of silence. Here‚Äôs what it said:

> ‚ÄúI love you. ALWAYS. I‚Äôm sorry. We need so much more than that. But I can‚Äôt breathe one more breath without you knowing that.‚Äù



I replied about 12 hours later. I told her I loved her too, that I had so much to say, and I wanted to know what prompted her to reach out. I‚Äôd written stuff down, hoping for closure. I said I wasn‚Äôt angry, just confused and hurting.

Her response (which I won‚Äôt post for privacy reasons) said she‚Äôd gone through marriage struggles and found peace in a church-based 12-step program (Proverbs 31, Lysa TerKeurst). Part of her ‚Äúhealing‚Äù was making amends with me. She also dropped a bomb: she had cut me off because of something I did 6‚Äì7 years ago. I won‚Äôt say exactly what, but I‚Äôll say this‚ÄîI messed up. I paid for it. I dealt with the shame, the consequences, and the fallout. It nearly broke me. I never did anything like that again. My family moved forward, therapy helped, and I was diagnosed with PTSD from trauma in my teens.

But she said she didn‚Äôt want her kids around ‚Äúthat.‚Äù I get it. I respect people making choices to protect their kids. But this was years later. I‚Äôd grown. And to cut me off without a word for the second hardest moment of my life‚Äîit hurt in a way I can‚Äôt really explain. She was always there for me. Except then.

We‚Äôve seen each other twice since she reached out, both times around the holidays. I‚Äôm not pushing for anything more‚ÄîI‚Äôm scared. And lonely. My husband isn‚Äôt someone I can really talk to, and my mom‚Äôs going through her own mental health struggles and tends to just agree with me because of the guilt she feels about the past.

I‚Äôm so f*cking lonely. I want connection again, but I‚Äôm terrified of trusting people. I don‚Äôt know how to make friends anymore. After years of keeping people at arm‚Äôs length, I don‚Äôt know where to start.

If you‚Äôve read this far, thank you. I‚Äôm just trying to make sense of it all.

Okay, maybe shaved-headed wasn't the right word for it. "Buzzed" was the word I was trying to think of lol.
