Hey everyone, I just wanted to share something that really changed the way I see my life and my struggles.
Like many of you, I've battled with feeling lost, stuck, and questioning my purpose. l've tried so many things, but nothing gave me lasting clarity... until I stumbled into something unexpected: using ChatGPT to explore numerology and self-discovery.
I know numerology sounds "out there" to some, but it's simply a tool for self-reflection based on your birth date and name. ChatGPT guided me through understanding my Life Path, Destiny, Soul, and more. What I found blew my mind, it described my strengths, my challenges, and even gave me language for the exact feelings and frustrations l've carried for years.
The biggest gift? It gave me a framework to understand why I am the way I am and showed me what l'm meant to build and focus on in this life. It hasn't magically solved everything, but i gave me direction, which brought back my motivation to keep going.
l'm sharing this because I know many people on this subreddit feel the same lostness. If you've never explored this, I HIGHLY recommend asking ChatGPT to do your numerology breakdown. It might just give you the clarity you've been craving.
You deserve to understand yourself deeply. You a deserve purpose.
This helped me start that journey, maybe it can help you too.

I‚Äôm not a professional, but I genuinely care and want to help in any way I can. Sometimes, all someone needs is a safe space, a friendly ear, or just a simple conversation to feel a little less isolated. If you ever need someone to talk to about anything I‚Äôm here. No pressure, no judgment.

Mental health matters, and so do you.

I‚Äôm asking because I am terrified that the people in my life think I‚Äôm lying when o tell them that I occasionally see things. They can be vivid or brief glimpses on the corners of my eyes ranging from fingers curling doorframes to full blown smiling faces peeking at me.

I keep my mirrors covered and my doors closed at all times to prevent myself from seeing them.

This was worse when I was 16-18 as I was constantly around people for college‚Ä¶

I get sleep paralysis and lucid dreams as well as extremely vivid nightmares‚Ä¶I talk in my sleep and shout from time to time‚Ä¶

These hallucinations are also tactile, as in I can sometimes feel I‚Äôm being touched. This often happens during sleep paralysis when I refuse to open my eyes.

I also keep seeing black cats where there are or can‚Äôt be black cats. This is especially tasty when I‚Äôm driving.

I‚Äôve got depression and anxiety‚Ä¶autism and I often get hemiplegic migraines‚Ä¶but I wonder where the sensory hallucinations end and the migraines begin as I often get the sensation that there are bugs crawling under my skin on my face‚Ä¶always on the right side‚Ä¶

My grandma asked her psychiatrist and he told her he thinks I take drugs‚Ä¶which I don‚Äôt really‚Ä¶I used to occasionally smoke weed but that caused me to madly hallucinate (whilst my friends were fine). I also  got accused of faking schizophrenia (why would anyone want schizophrenia!?)‚Ä¶so I avoid talking to people about it‚Ä¶

It got so bad that I had to have my boyfriend (at 17) come to the toilet with me because I was convinced there were demons out to kill me‚Ä¶not tasty.

I'm becoming like my mother. I'm becoming like my mom, and I hate it. I'm irritable and closed off, just like she is. And no matter what conversations I try to have with her, we always end back where we started. Our relationship feels stuck. She says she's trying to change and become better, that she can't change the past, but how am I supposed to move on? How am I supposed to forgive her for how she made me feel? For how litle she was around during the most crucial parts of my development? When I needed my mother the most, she wasn't there. My grandparents essentially raised me for the six years she was in a relationship. I saw her once, twice a week at best. She did work nights, so not all of it was her fault, but there was no legitimate reason for how infrequently she came home during that time. Nonetheless, I am my mother's daughter. I essentially hide from my family in my bedroom. It doesn't take much to piss me off, but I avoid taking it out on people as best I can. I hate when people do that. My mother does that. I hope that I don't do it, but friends have described me as short-tempered in the past.
My own resentment with my mother has reflected onto my relationship with my aunt and her kids. The only logical conclusion is jealousy. They have an active mother, a present father (who isn't exactly my favorite person, but that's irrelevant right now), and that they're being parented in a drastically different way. They're a little crazy in public. I was never allowed to act that way. I was too scared of the consequences. A strange part of me wishes that I wasn't alone. That I wouldn't be the only one damaged in the same by our family. That it wasn't my fault at all, and my current behavior and thought processes couldn't be helped. I understand that it's immature, but it's the best way to describe my actions. At least, my past ones. Now, I mainly try to isolate myself. I think those kids would be better off without me anyway. I'm becoming like my mother, after all. I don't like who I am, the way I look, the way I think. I'm far from rolemodel material, in my eyes. I want those kids to be better than I am. I want them to be able to love themselves wholeheartedly. 
I feel angry and resentful of my whole immediate family, to be honest. The easy route, peaceful route, even, is to cut all of them off when I go to college. I like being alone. I've always been independent. My happiness, or lack thereof, relies on myself. But that wouldn't change the fact that I'm my mother's daughter. My flaws would travel with me, regardless of where I go or who I meet. I need to become better, but looking myself in the eyes and admitting that I'm even more flawed than I originally thought, hurts. And I don't want to hurt anymore. I also don't want to admit that I'm part of the problem and old enough to try and fix it.

I really don't know what's wrong with me at this point. I go through these phases of being all go-lucky making jokes, hanging out with my friend group, but then I'll randomly wake up one day, get to school, not talk to anyone, feel like crying, can't focus on anything. And it's like, nothing even happened? Why am I like this? I think what hurts the most for me though is the fact that whenever I go through these episodes, MY 'BEST' FRIENDS DONT EVEN TALK TO ME, OR ASK IF IM OKAY. WHICH I CLEARLY AIN'T IF IM SITTING IN A CORNER BY MYSELF WITH DEAD EYES. Whatever. I'm just really confused about what's going on with me.


Edit: probably should've added that these phases are BAD. If I said what happened during them I would have to change the tag of this post lol-

Current Symptoms
Cognitive Symptoms
* Memory Issues
    * Forgetting recent conversations or repeating questions.
* Word-Finding Difficulties
    * Difficulty recalling specific words or names.
    * Occasionally using incorrect terms (e.g., saying ‚Äúplate‚Äù instead of ‚Äúbowl‚Äù).
* Automatic Behavior Errors
    * Turning off lights mid-task (e.g., after a shower before finishing up).
    * Typing ‚Äúphone‚Äù into a search bar instead of locating an app.
    * Pouring a drink over food instead of using the sauce beside it.
* Task Interruption / Loss of Train of Thought
    * Forgetting what I was doing mid-task.
    * Needing to pause or retrace steps to remember my intention.
* Mental Fatigue / Brain Fog
    * Feeling foggy, mentally slowed, or mentally drained.
    * Reduced ability to focus or maintain clarity.

Physical Sensations
* Localized Heat Sensation (Intermittent)
    * A short (~10-minute) sensation of heat on the left side of the head.
    * Often occurs during periods of stress or mental overload.
* Trembling and Physical Overwhelm (Intermittent)
    * Episodes of trembling and a sense of being mentally or physically overwhelmed.

Emotional & Psychological Symptoms
* Elevated Stress and Anxiety
    * Persistent health-related worry and mental strain.
    * Some reduction recently, but baseline anxiety remains elevated.

Relevant History / Possible Contributing Factors
Sertraline Reintroduction (Fall 2024)
* In fall of last year, after having been off of sertraline for some time, I took 100 mg for 2 days (my usual dose was 50 mg).
* Shortly after restarting, I experienced trembling, mental overwhelm, and worsened cognitive symptoms.
* These symptoms led me to stop taking it again. It‚Äôs unclear if this reaction contributed to ongoing issues.
Pre-Headache Sensation (Fall 2024)
* Around 9 days before stopping sertraline, I experienced a persistent tension or ‚Äúpre-headache‚Äù sensation that lasted for about 3 days.
* This did not progress into a full headache but felt like pressure or build-up in the head.
* It‚Äôs unclear whether this was stress-related, medication-related, or another trigger.

May 26 will mark 6 years that l've been dealing with functional neurological disorder

Since childhood, I‚Äôve struggled to adapt. I was always afraid of people and couldn‚Äôt connect socially. Between ages 4 and 7, I had multiple surgeries, and during that time, my parents didn‚Äôt give me space to grow or express myself. Later, I was exposed to violence from my father, and I grew up in a constant state of anxiety. I felt it even as a kid ‚Äî like something was wrong with me from the start.

I was born premature (7 months), and doctors didn‚Äôt expect me to have a healthy future. When I moved in with just my mom, the anxiety got a little quieter, but the fear stayed. I could never express my thoughts clearly or think fast like others. I always felt different. Misunderstood. Alone. I was often humiliated, afraid, and disconnected from others.

At 13, I found friends online and disappeared into that world. But even there, things fell apart. I felt like people backed off once they saw who I really was ‚Äî insecure, awkward, unstable. I‚Äôve tried different things to find myself. Got two jobs, lost both. I always feel like my brain doesn‚Äôt work right. I let down even the few people who cared. I don‚Äôt understand what I want. I can‚Äôt live like others.

About a year ago, due to many problems, I moved back in with my dad ‚Äî and things got even worse. I didn‚Äôt feel supported. I lied all the time ‚Äî to myself, to others. I couldn‚Äôt defend myself or speak up. I just existed. Like a vegetable. It felt like nobody took me seriously as a person.

I often feel overwhelmed by everything, and sometimes I think about ending my life. These thoughts scare me, but they keep coming back. I don‚Äôt want to feel this way, but I don‚Äôt know how to stop them.

Now I‚Äôm 18. I live like a disabled person. I‚Äôve achieved nothing. I sit on my phone all day, smoke cigarettes and weed, and just dream about a better life that I don‚Äôt believe in anymore. I‚Äôm addicted to weed, I know that. But I don‚Äôt stop. Everything feels pointless. I can‚Äôt be ‚Äúnormal‚Äù in communication, friendships, relationships, even as a son. I don‚Äôt see a future for myself. I just survive, lying to myself and others. And no one believes in me.

Even when my girlfriend cheated on me, I didn‚Äôt leave. I was too weak. I scream at my mom, even though she‚Äôs the only one still here. I‚Äôm selfish, useless, dumb, and I keep making the same mistakes. I see no way out.

I don‚Äôt want to do anything. I just sit all day suffering, smoking, dreaming of a better life. But I don‚Äôt act. I feel like nothing in my life has meaning. I‚Äôve never been able to be ‚Äúnormal.‚Äù I don‚Äôt know how to build relationships, how to be a good son, how to be a friend or just a person who belongs. I don‚Äôt see a future. I‚Äôm just surviving.

I‚Äôm not writing this for pity. I just can‚Äôt hold it in anymore. If anyone out there feels the same or has felt this ‚Äî please, say something. I just want to know I‚Äôm not the only one. That maybe, somehow, there‚Äôs still a chance to get out of this.

This is just a short version. There‚Äôs a lot more I haven‚Äôt said. I struggle to express my thoughts properly, but if anyone‚Äôs interested, I could go into more detail.

I‚Äôd really appreciate any thoughts, advice, or support. Thank you.

Hi all,
I have taken a ¬£400 per month pay cut. 
I'm two months into my new job. 
I'm not sat at a pc everyday. And it's a job I've always been interested in going. People even volunteer to do it. 
However it's charity sector. So pay is of course, terrible. 
All I can say, yeah it might take me longer to get what material things I want.

Will I be in this job forever ? I don't know. But the only thing I can share is what a difference your colleagues and boss make to you're overall wellbeing.

I‚Äôm not here to save anyone. I‚Äôm not some kind of hero‚ÄîI‚Äôm just a guy who's been through hell, carrying pieces of it in my chest. Most days, I‚Äôm still figuring myself out. But I‚Äôve lived enough pain, seen enough loss, and walked through enough dark nights to know how powerful it is just to hear: you‚Äôre not alone.

I‚Äôve lost people I love. People who should still be here. And I‚Äôve blamed myself for things I couldn‚Äôt control. I‚Äôve carried shame that didn‚Äôt belong to me. I‚Äôve made choices I wish I hadn‚Äôt. I‚Äôve stared in the mirror and seen nothing but wreckage. And yeah‚Äîthere are days I still feel like that.

But over time, I‚Äôve realized something important:

I‚Äôm not broken. I‚Äôm a mosaic.

I‚Äôm made up of the pieces of everything I‚Äôve survived. The cracks, the scars, the battles‚Äîthey don‚Äôt ruin me. They define me. They make me real. And that‚Äôs not something to hide from‚Äîit‚Äôs something to stand in.

This message isn‚Äôt coming from someone with all the answers. It‚Äôs coming from someone who still wakes up and chooses to keep going, even when it‚Äôs hard. Someone who knows that just getting out of bed can be a victory.

If you‚Äôre struggling‚Äîif you feel shattered, lost, or invisible‚Äîjust know this: you‚Äôre not alone. You‚Äôre not a lost cause. You‚Äôre not damaged goods.

You are a mosaic, too.

And if no one‚Äôs told you lately: I‚Äôm proud of you. Not because you‚Äôre perfect. Not because you‚Äôve got it all together. But because you‚Äôre still here. You‚Äôre still trying. That matters more than you know.

I don‚Äôt have a stage. I don‚Äôt have fame. But I do have a voice‚Äîand I‚Äôll use it to remind anyone who needs to hear it:

You matter. You are seen. And no matter how many pieces you‚Äôre in, you are still whole.

I'm a 15 year old girl who wants to advocate for mental health, especially for teenagers. We have problems too but adults often just dismiss is as "typical teenager behavior" when in reality, we're really struggling. With all the bullying, cyberbullying and harassment in the world. It seems like it's not getting better. Whenever adults are brutally honest, they get praised and worshipped like Gods, but when it comes to us adolescents, we get discriminated and punished for speaking up about our experiences. 

And people always say "It'll get better", as if trying actually helps, because I've talked about mental health issues with my school counselor and she's like "It won't last forever", well.... actually, it does last forever for some people. I have PTSD, anxiety and depression from getting cheated on and having verbally abusive people in my life. Along with having trust issues and sometimes feeling bad about myself, with having a learning disability and ADHD, it feels like no one cares.

More people need to take mental health seriously, it's just as important as physical health (but some stupid people don't recognize that). 

So, if anyone has similar problems and thoughts and tips on what to do, I'd glady appreciate it.

I‚Äôve been struggling for years with something that doesn‚Äôt fully match the diagnoses I‚Äôve been given so far. It‚Äôs not just anxiety or sadness. It‚Äôs more like abrupt shifts in my mental state sometimes without any clear trigger. Most of the time, I feel emotionally and mentally blocked: disconnected, unmotivated, insecure, hopeless, and often anxious. It‚Äôs like I lose access to who I am. My thoughts feel foggy, I can‚Äôt express myself, and even simple conversations feel impossible.

But then, randomly, I shift into a completely different state. I feel clear-headed, confident, social, funny, and alive. Like the real me suddenly returns. I want to talk to people, connect, get things done. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs mania it doesn‚Äôt feel out of control just a rare moment of normalcy. But it always fades again without warning. And the inconsistency is exhausting.

Yes, I do have anxiety, and probably some depressive symptoms too. But I don‚Äôt believe this is just Generalized Anxiety Disorder. Based on everything I‚Äôve read and researched, it feels more like a mood regulation issue or something involving neurotransmitter dysfunction. I‚Äôm seeing a therapist and psychiatrist, but I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm being taken seriously. I keep getting labeled with standard anxiety or OCD diagnoses that don‚Äôt fully reflect what I‚Äôm going through.

Medication-wise, I‚Äôm currently changing effexor to sertraline after years of effexor, im also taking 150mg Lyrica. No major side effects, but no real improvement either. I just feel the same as beforeflat, disconnected. It‚Äôs frustrating.

Has anyone else experienced something like this? These unpredictable shifts in how you feel and function, even when your environment stays the same? I‚Äôm tired of being misdiagnosed and just want to figure out what‚Äôs actually going on with me.

All my life until not so long I had been an emotional guy. I think it has to do with my mum being 80% of my  overprotective upbringing.

Used to avoid direct confrontation, even when necesary. Always polite, always de-escalating conflicts even when I should have spoken up. I remember having a friend a school that one time I replied back his bad manners and resulted in him turning around and pushed my books off my desk. And I did nothing again because I was a coward and taught not to get into troubles.

Its not easy to find the people, places, or even addictions that seem normal but yet are toxic to your life. Whether its a friend, parent or just an old acquaintance you'll have to step back from the picture to see the truth. Are you close in photos with someone but you don't smile as you used to? Are you reconnecting and things are not going right? Are you told you aren't good enough in any actions, words, or just simply scoffed at? These are toxic flags and can be subtle as it can be called a joke, or the person is just having fun at your expense. 

The fact someone is doing so could seem harmless to them but it harms your mind creating a feeling its ok as it continues; this is worse as its a conditioning we were taught as children. The reason so many people tend to shutdown and remove themselves \*kinder words\* from this planet full of people. There are survivors after these events which rip open major psychological events for friends, families and cause worse events to occur. 

When one loses themselves after an event like this it becomes clear to that survivors of the event it can occur again. These survivors become numb, have high thresholds' of pain, and can disassociate from these points. There are triggers that can cause major, minor and temporary setbacks to life. These can last for short term, long-term, and even the whole of the survivors lifetime.  They range form subtle masking to major blowouts and can severely horrid episodic disfunctions.

The reasons can be numerous yet the results are enigmatic and downright crushing to the soul. 

List of Reasons

Abuse - whether physical or mental lead to emotional invulnerability and overthinking. this is one extreme. The other side is super sensitivity to situational elements. 

Have you suffered at someone's hands, cruel words, or even emotional trauma?

Can you spot the beginning of the trauma center or have been there so long that you don't know where to look?

Abandoning - whether parental, partnership, or a close friends these feelings create an insecure person from this or they can spiral the other way and become impossible to deal with.

You'll see this in people who've become overly clingy, needy, or stoic due to the trauma key.  Trust issues often follow this.

Manipulation - creating weak spots that one can easily make others shutdown with. Did dad not say anything about your straight A's or did demean for getting a B? Did you find your partner cold until they wanted something for them yet your needs go unfulfilled when you ask for something? Are ignored until your useful to someone? 

These are 3 ways people often take themselves off the menu of life. this is due to heartless cold snobby people \*if you can call them that\* who are there to hurt the people around them through control and and many other ways can be spoken of that are just as hurtful. Abusers, control freaks, and manipulators often use these to to keep prey around. Break the cycle before you become the next victim of it.

For informational purposes only. 

If you've survived any form of these seek professional help and remain vigilant for others in the situation. NOTE you can't help everyone but you can save those who'll listen.

Maybe a minute passed and with my hands covering my face I feel something pressing into my chest. At first I thought it was the cat and then realized it was him. He asked if I was ok and said he was sorry for making me sad. 

He sat with me, hugging me, for a couple minutes and then gently got up and walked back to his room. Once I was able to control myself I got back up and went to him and sat to watch him play with his toys before bed. He stopped playing and sat in my lap, put his arms around me and head to my chest. Again he apologized and this time said he thought he did something wrong by upsetting me. I couldn‚Äôt put thoughts or words together enough to explain to him that he did nothing wrong and why it got to me so much. He‚Äôs such a sweet, caring little boy and I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better son to carry on our family name.

March of last year my father (69 y/o) was killed in a plane crash that he was piloting. From the time that I was 16 until 35 we had a horrible relationship. He favored my sisters more than me and was nowhere near as hard on them. I was always trying to get him to change the cycle that he grew up with and hated, but he was too damn stubborn. My son (turning 5 in July) was the pivotal factor in my relationship with my father. Once my father found out that my first born would be a boy, our relationship started to get better. He started to call more. Started to text me more. We lived 5 hours apart so visiting was not very often. Actually he only came here 4 times in the 8 years that I‚Äôve lived here which is more than the 6 years I was back in NY after I got out of the service. But I digress. 

Ever since his crash I have been battling the grief and mourning of losing him. The daily torture of the questions of what did I do wrong? Why couldn‚Äôt I get through sooner? Why couldn‚Äôt we have more time? 

At his funeral last year, as it is done in the Jewish faith, he was lowered into his grave next to my great grandparents and his father and the male next of kin symbolically place the first scoops of dirt onto the casket. I took my son (3 at the time) up to the grave after I, his only son, and his 2 brothers placed our scoops. I am not a practicing Jew but I felt it was necessary since he was still involved with the temple, which I found out he was more active with than I even knew afterwards. Day forward to about a month ago, a year after the burial, and my son randomly mentions that he misses ‚ÄúPapa Steven‚Äù. My father. I was stunned. Without showing him my disbelief, or at least I don‚Äôt think I did, I asked him what he remembered about him. He says he ‚Äúremembers us throwing dirt on a box‚Äù. Again I was shocked and could not believe that he remembered even that. It It‚Äôs something I truly hope he never forgets. 

My wife and I are going through a divorce. This weekend I will be away while her parents come to pack up her things and help her and the kids get back to NY to live with them until she gets something for herself. This has obviously only added to my chronic depression, clinically diagnosed asking with PTSD from the service, and while I thought I was handling it pretty well, the closer we get to them leaving, the harder it‚Äôs becoming. Especially since the kids have no idea and just think they‚Äôre going to grandma‚Äôs and papa‚Äôs for the summer. 

While I was getting my daughter (3 y/o) ready for bed, my son randomly mentioned missing Papa Steven, again. That was when I broke. I couldn‚Äôt keep it in anymore. My eyes started to swell. That knot in my throat became overwhelming and my breathing turned to gasping. He said he wanted to talk to Papa Steven and my wife told him he could talk to him anytime he wanted, ‚Äújust like how he talks to god when he prays‚Äù. So what does this child do? He says he‚Äôs ‚Äúgoing to talk to him in peace and quiet, so no talking‚Äù. He walks into his room and I can barely hear him but am able to make out a few words here and there. I hear him say that he really misses him and wishes to see him again, wants to show him his toys and hopes he‚Äôs ok and finishes with ‚Äúthank you, dear god, amen‚Äù. I couldn‚Äôt contain the emotion anymore and completely lost it. I went to the kitchen and wiped my face, curled into a corner and cried.
